documents.document: @Peiling20I7 Well, I think I have my hands pretty full with American politics at the moment.

@BPLewis Sadly, consumers will eventually just normalize it like they did baggage fees. Airlines will laugh their way to bank.
@BPLewis Frontier and Spirit get away with it because they are positioned as a budget carrier, with actual lower prices.
@BPLewis Worst part is that I'm willing to bet their new Basic Economy fare won't actually be cheaper. They're banking on incremental $1B.
Love @Silvercar, but their customer experience is beginning to suffer as they scale. It's a diff pick up process every time I come to LAX.
I'm at Los Angeles International Airport - @flylaxairport in Los Angeles, CA https://t.co/98Ot8DdVBG
#nowplaying (barely) through my abysmal $39.95 @GoGo Wi-Fi. Incredible playlist tho. https://t.co/MqYJlYqLim
@sophiacrowley We'll see. Just like baggage fees didn't go away after gas prices fell, @united isn't interested in saving people money.
@sophiacrowley Yup, Frontier and Spirit are budget airlines with cheaper fares. @United isn't lowering their prices, so u pay more for less.
@sophiacrowley @tinnkky @united @washingtonpost I don't think it's misleading at all. It's actually calling it how it is.
@kawikabernal I thought so too, but swear my check in didn't give me an option to pre-purchase. But yeah, that speed... Woof.
@LoveBrianaXO Tough not flying @united, living in Denver no?

Airlines started bag fees b/c of rising gas prices. Gas went down, fees remained. Now @united will add $1B in revenue.
Nothing but greed.
The most egregious part is how @United is positioning it as a base tier below Economy. Yet I doubt we'll be paying less for "Basic Economy."
